background_description: The background consists of a rough, textured surface, likely tree bark, heavily covered in patches of green moss and various shades of grey and white lichen. The surface has an irregular, bumpy topography with crevices and protrusions.
camouflage_type: Color blending / Pattern matching / Shape disruption
explanation: The spider exhibits exceptional camouflage against its environment. Its body and legs are covered in a mottled pattern of light grey, greenish-brown, and white, perfectly mirroring the colors and patterns of the lichen and moss-covered bark. The irregular, bumpy texture of its cephalothorax and abdomen, combined with the banded patterns on its long, slender legs, breaks up its outline and blends seamlessly with the natural irregularities, textures, and shadows of the background. This combination of color, pattern, and shape disruption makes it extremely difficult to distinguish the spider from the substrate.
